meanings.definition: Admit (someone) formally to a position or organization.
meanings.sent1: The school was inducting new students into the student council.
meanings.sent2: The company was inducting new employees into their team.
meanings.sent3: The magician was inducting volunteers from the audience into his act.
meanings.sent4: The coach was inducting players into the starting lineup.
meanings.sent5: The ceremony for inducting members into the hall of fame was a grand event.

meanings.definition: Introduce (someone) to a new activity or skill.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was inducting the students into the world of science experiments.
meanings.sent2: The mentor was inducting the apprentice into the art of woodworking.
meanings.sent3: The chef was inducting the trainee into the art of making soufflés.
meanings.sent4: The guide was inducting the tourists into the beauty of the national park.
meanings.sent5: The coach was inducting the team into the strategy of the game.

meanings.definition: Install (someone) in a new job or position.
meanings.sent1: The company was inducting the new manager into their leadership role.
meanings.sent2: The organization was inducting the new CEO into their executive position.
meanings.sent3: The team was inducting the rookie player into the starting lineup.
meanings.sent4: The school was inducting the new teacher into their classroom.
meanings.sent5: The committee was inducting the new member into their board.
